tactical_doctrine.role: Defense of Egypt against Italian invasion from Libya
special_capabilities: Mobile desert warfare with armoured formations
tactical_innovations: Mobile Support Group concept for combined arms
Extensive use of armoured cars for reconnaissance screen
known_issues: Significantly outnumbered by Italian forces (5:1 ratio)
Tank mechanical reliability issues in desert conditions
Limited air support compared to Regia Aeronautica
Cruiser tanks suffered wear and tear - 15 of 85 under repair
Supply lines stretched from Egyptian bases
tactical_doctrine.desert_adaptations: Enhanced water capacity, desert navigation equipment, modified air filters for vehicles, specialized desert uniforms and equipment

confidence_change.rationale: Upgraded from 4 Wikipedia + 3 tertiary sources to 6 Tier 1 primary sources (Playfair, Nafziger, TM 30-410, Army Lists, Joslen, Long) + 2 Tier 2 specialist sources (Barr, Osprey). All equipment counts and personnel data preserved.

source_upgrade.methodology: Replaced all Wikipedia and tertiary sources with official British military histories, primary archival documents (Nafziger Collection), War Office publications (Army Lists, Joslen), US War Department intelligence (TM 30-410), Australian official history, and specialist military historians (Barr, Osprey).
source_upgrade.verification_notes: Commander O'Connor appointment verified in Joslen and British Army Lists Q2-Q3 1940. WDF composition (7th Armoured Division + 4th Indian Division + 7th Support Group + 7th RTR) confirmed in Playfair Vol I Chapter II. Tank strengths cross-verified between Nafziger Collection 940BIAA and Playfair operational narratives. 4th Indian Division presence in WDF Sept 1940 confirmed in Long Australian Official History and Playfair.

Precise personnel breakdown by rank (estimated proportions)
Exact truck and vehicle counts (estimated from divisional establishments)

RAF aircraft support numbers (RAF Western Desert was separate command)
validation.data_quality_notes: Good historical documentation for command structure and major unit composition. Tank numbers well-documented from multiple sources. Personnel estimates based on divisional establishment and historical accounts. Equipment details estimated from standard British formations of 1940. 4th Indian Division confirmed present in WDF during Sept 1940, moved to Sudan in December 1940.
validation.historical_context: Western Desert Force was formed 17 June 1940 from HQ 6th Infantry Division. In September 1940, it faced the Italian invasion of Egypt (13-16 Sept) with significantly inferior numbers but superior training and mobility. The force would later launch Operation Compass in December 1940, achieving spectacular success against the Italian 10th Army.
